Manage commands to be evaluated

Source: R/commands.R
INTERNAL_manage_commands.Rd

Functions to manage pending and processed commands to be evaluated.

.initialize_cmd_store()

.add_command(obj, cmd, name = NULL)

.evaluate_commands(obj, envir)

.text_eval(cmd, envir)

Arguments

obj

A command store produced by .initialize_cmd_store.
cmd

A character vector containing commands to be executed at some point in time.
name

A character vector containing names for the commands.
envir

An environment in which to execute the commands.

Value

A command store, i.e., a list of two character vectors pending and processed.

.initialize_cmd_store will return a command store with two empty vectors.

.add_command will append cmd to pending.

.evaluate_commands will evaluate any pending commands in envir, and then move them to the processed vector. If envir=NULL, no evaluation will be performed but the pending commands will still be moved to processed - useful for mimicking evaluation.

.text_eval returns the output of eval(parse(text=cmd), envir), unless cmd is empty in which case it returns NULL.

Contents

  • Arguments
  • Value

Author

Aaron Lun
